newsitem.title: FRANCE: Rhone-Poulenc has 28 pct of CFPI, may seek control.
newsitem.headline: Rhone-Poulenc has 28 pct of CFPI, may seek control.

text.p: French pharmaceuticals and chemicals group Rhone-Poulenc said on Sunday it had raised its stake in chemicals firm Compagnie Francaise de Produits Industriels (CFPI) to 28.4 percent and may go further.
In a statement, Rhone-Poulenc said it bought 10.1 percent of CFPI's shares from French banking group Paribas.
"The Rhone-Poulenc group is acting independently and reserves every possibility to increase its stake in CFPI and does not totally exclude taking control," it said.
Rhone-Poulenc said it was primarily interested in CFPI because of its agrochemical activities.
Its stake-building was part of a strategy to strengthen its position on world markets for herbicides and growth regulators.
It was also pursuing its aim of collaborating with CFPI in the production and distribution of the Oxynils herbicides and the plant growth regulator called Ethephon.
Rhone-Poulenc did not give a price for the share purchase.
On October 25, New Zealand firm Fernz Corp said it had bought 11.25 percent of CFPI for NZ$9.5 million.
It said CFPI had net assets of around 350 million francs and sales of 1.4 billion francs.
Rhone-Poulenc and Paribas both declined comment on Friday on French market speculation that Rhone-Poulenc had built its stake in CFPI from 16.19 percent by buying 10 percent from Paribas.
CFPI stock strongly outpaced a firmer Paris share market on Friday to close up 8.2 percent at 303.0 francs per share.
Rhone-Poulenc shares gained 0.19 percent to 160.7 francs, while the CAC-40 index of leading shares rose nearly one percent to finish at a year-high of 2,255.47 points.
